Rep: Chris Jacobs co-sponsored the "Pre-existing Conditions Protection Act of 2019" which contains provisions to protect patients, including prohibiting insurers from excluding certain benefits based on pre-existing conditions, prohibiting charging people with pre-existing conditions higher premiums, and guaranteeing that people will be issued policies.
The bill co: sponsored by Rep. Chris Jacobs, H.R. 692, has 83 co-sponsors, all Republicans, indicating support for protecting pre-existing conditions among the Republican party.
